intro: Brachyglottis bifistulosa, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its narrow, strap-like leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant is often found in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It has historical significance for Māori use in basket weaving and traditional medicine. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for native insects and birds.
